derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, or from late Latin visitatio(n-), from the verb visitare (see visit)

entry.def: A visitation is an event in which God or another non-human being seems to appear to someone or contact them.

example.ex: The young people have claimed almost daily visitations from the Virgin Mary.
example.tran: 这些年轻人说几乎每天都会看到圣母马利亚显圣。

entry.tran: 视察;巡视;光临;到访（幽默的说法）
entry.def: People sometimes refer humorously to a visit from someone, especially from someone in authority, as a visitation .

example.ex: They had another visitation from Essex police.
example.tran: 埃塞克斯的警察再次拜访了他们。

entry.def: Visitation is the act of officially visiting someone.

example.ex: House-to-house visitation has been carried on, under the regulations of the General Board of Health...
example.tran: 根据卫生委员会的规定，挨家挨户的探访持续进行了下去。

means.word_mean: 1. an annoying or frustrating or catastrophic event;

sentences.sentence: "his mother-in-law's visits were a great trial for him"

means.word_mean: 3. an official visit for inspection or supervision;

sentences.sentence: "the commissioner made visitations to all the precinct stations"
"the recent visitation of the bishop to his diocese"
